result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Michael Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation already on

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling or combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week.

No contact with L.M. unless allowed by agent.  

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete SAFE program and any follow up which can be tranfsferred to Wood County.  Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent.  

Complete AODA with follow through.  

DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:57am
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person, pro se.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Amend Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse-Domestic Abuse Repeater-Repeater to delete enhancers Domestic Abuse Repeater and enhancer Repeater, which makes charge a misdemeanor now
COURT grants above
PLEA:  
Ct. 1 DC-Domestic Abuse->> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation, concurrent to any other probation already on. Complete SAFE program and any follow up which can be transfered to Wood County. Complete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Pay CC, plus one Domestic Abuse surcharge. DNA sample and surcharge. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. No contact with victim L.M. unless allowed by agent. 2 days credit granted, if revoked. 

Adj: 11:12am

Clerk Becky. 
Case Called: 9:45 am
State appears by ADA M. Puerner; Deft appears in person pro se.
Marshfield Officer Tanner Gruber sworn & testifies; identifies deft;
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Bond:  Continued
Future dates are set.

Adj: 9:52 am

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 11:53am
Defendent does appear

Court questions deft Re: Employment/Income.
Court denies apptment of Counsel, dft not found indigent.

Adj: 11:57am
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena emailed to T.G. 9/28/15)

Pre-trial conference at 09-28-2015 09:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing at 10-05-2015 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference at 10-26-2015 09:00 am.

$1000.00 signature bond with first $200.00 in cash.    No contact with victim(s):  L.M. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  Absolute sobriety from drugs or unless valid prescription for medications.
